intro: Senecio multivenius, commonly known as the velvetleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has dark green, velvety leaves that are deeply lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Senecio multivenius is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and adaptability to different growing conditions.
